page.title: 02Traffic in South Molton
page.content: South Molton is a market town. On Thursday a lot of country people come to market.When the farmers and shoppers come in to town they park on yellow lines because all the other places are taken up and you can't drive through the narrow streets because of them.We did a traffic survey on the main road on Thursday morning and found that 265 cars, 33 lorries, 3 caravans, 6 trailers, 3 tractors, 31 vans, 1 motorbike and 14 landrovers. The lorries unloading their food and goods have to park by the shops and you can't get past and it causes problems. In the summer the roads get blocked by holiday makers passing through. It would help if they built a multi-storey car park and also they are building a bypass road from
